review_text: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! . I've been coming to Lewiwsburg/Selinsgrove area, annually for 25+ years to visit a very close friend. The Isle of Que is a very cool, quiet and quaint area, actually on a small island. Really, nice, cozy & private studio like accomodation, with vaulted ceiling and small 2nd floor couch/reading area - VERY comfy couch ... all in a very quiet area. If you're looking for solitude and a great spot to get away & relax, Vern & Chris' Cabin on the Que is a sure bet. Super clean, as advertised, new "everything, large private 2nd floor outside deck overlooking peaceful countryside and cornfields, screened back French door to let evening breeze in, or flip on overhead fan or AC. The only thing that would brighten it up would be some windows, but 2 skylights help with that. Just 2 minute walk to Front St bordering the Susquehanna River, makes for relaxing, lovely walk any time of day. Little to no traffic here, as it's a long dead end road. A 10 minute walk into "downtown" Selinsgrove to 2 popular (& favorite) restaurants, or drive if you'd prefer. Quaint Lewisburg 15 or so minutes up Rt 11/15, and plenty of retail shopping minutes away in Shamokin Dam. GREAT VALUE FOR THE MONEY HERE! Prompt reply to any questions. Very accomodating.

We arrived after the sun set so didn't get a look at the scenery until the next morning when we were greeted with a gorgeous view of the mist rising from the Susquehanna
as the sun was just starting to rise. Later that day had a lovely stroll along the river.
The space consists of the bathroom, bedroom, and a large room that has the kitchen, dining area, and very comfy living room and fireplace. There is a TV with streaming capability, but we chose to put on music, settle back in the very comfortable furniture, and read. We really appreciated the motion-activated light in the hallway that came on as we stepped out of the bedroom for nighttime trips to the bathroom! Other than a short step from the patio to the entry door of the unit, all is on a single level and so should be fine if someone had minor mobility issues. So, yes, it is a lovely, safe, and peaceful place to stay with a kind and hospitable host.
In case some wonder about sound transference between the guest suite and the family's living quarters upstairs, you do hear the odd footstep and the occasional murmur of voices overhead (where Rob and his family live}, but it was not disruptive or bothersome. I am very sensitive to sound and did not find it to be a problem. When outside you do hear a bit of the distant traffic on the highway, but when inside it is very peaceful.
We were there 2 nights and had to be up early and gone most of the day visiting a relative in a nearby town, but could see that the space would be ideal for a longer stay, too. The kitchen has just about anything one would need to prepare meals and there is a washer and dryer in the spacious bathroom. Outside there are several inviting spots to sit and read or chat.
We would absolutely stay again in Rob's lovely spot by the river! It was a treat.
Glenn and Sue
